label_from_instance(obj)¶

Convert objects into strings and generate the labels for the choices presented by this object. Subclasses can override this method to customize the display of the choices.

cosinnus.forms.attached_object module¶

class cosinnus.forms.attached_object.AttachableObjectSelect2MultipleChoiceField(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: HeavyModelSelect2MultipleChoiceField

clean(value)¶

We organize the ids gotten back from the recipient select2 field. This is a list of mixed ids which could either be groups or users. See cosinnus.views.user.UserSelect2View for how these ids are built.

Example for <value>: [u’cosinnus_event.Event:1’, u’cosinnus_file.FileEntry:1’]

data_view¶

alias of AttachableObjectSelect2View

queryset¶

alias of AttachedObject

class cosinnus.forms.attached_object.AttachableWidgetSelect2Field(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AttachableObjectSelect2MultipleChoiceField

clean(value)¶

We organize the ids gotten back from the recipient select2 field. This is a list of mixed ids which could either be groups or users. See cosinnus.views.user.UserSelect2View for how these ids are built.

Example for <value>: [u’cosinnus_event.Event:1’, u’cosinnus_file.FileEntry:1’]

class cosinnus.forms.attached_object.FormAttachableMixin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Used together with AttachableViewMixin.

Extending this form will automatically add fields for all attachable cosinnus models (as configured in settings.COSINNUS_ATTACHABLE_OBJECTS) to a form. Even though there is a different field for each attachable model, this form handles saving all selected objects to the object’s attached_objects M2M field.

save_attachable()¶

Called by AttachableViewMixin.form_valid() For some reason, this field is not being saved automatically, even though field and model field are named the same. We also run this on any instances in self.extra_instances, because sometimes like in postman, forms save aways more than one instance.

class cosinnus.forms.conference.ConferenceSettingsFormMixin¶

Bases: object

Mixin containing the form logic for saving attached CosinnusConferenceSettings. Can be used with either a regular form or a MultiForm

add_preset_fields_to_form(conference_settings_instance=None)¶
bbb_nature = None¶
commit_conference_settings_from_data(parent_object, instance=None, formfield_prefix='', commit=True)¶

Prepare the conference settings object with data from the form

get_bbb_settings_parent()¶

Returns the parent object in the BBB settings chain. Uses explicitly set bbb_settings_parent form attribute or falls back to portal if attribute is not set.

get_group_object()¶

Stub, implement this to return the group of the object that this conference settings object is be attached to

clean()¶

Hook for doing any extra form-wide cleaning after Field.clean() has been called on every field. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field named ‘__all__’.

class cosinnus.forms.filters.AllObjectsFilter(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: ChoiceFilter

property field¶

Choices for this filter field are all related objects in this group that are actually assigned to any objects in this group. Example: All users that have created a TodoEntry in the displayed group.

filter(qs, value)¶

Filters for field-is-empty on ‘None’ parameters

clean()¶

Hook for doing any extra form-wide cleaning after Field.clean() has been called on every field. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field named ‘__all__’.

clean_flickr_url()¶
clean_sdgs()¶
clean_twitter_username()¶

check username and enforce ‘@’

clean_twitter_widget_id()¶

Accept Widget-id (example: 744907261810618721) or embed-code (HTML) always returns empty or a numeral like 744907261810618721

clean_video()¶

full_clean()¶

class cosinnus.forms.group.GroupKwargModelFormMixin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Generic model form mixin for popping group out of the kwargs and attaching it to the instance.

This mixin must precede forms.ModelForm / forms.Form. The form is not expecting these kwargs to be passed in, so they must be popped off before anything else is done.

cosinnus.forms.search module¶

class cosinnus.forms.search.TaggableModelSearchForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: SearchForm

This is almost the same search form as shipped with django-haystack except it limits the choices to models that are a subclasses of the BaseTaggableObjectModel.

MAX_RESULTS = 200¶

cosinnus.forms.search.filter_searchqueryset_for_portal(sqs, portals=None, restrict_multiportals_to_current=False, exchange=False)¶

Filters a searchqueryset by which portal the objects belong to. @param portals: If not provided, will default to this portal and all foreign portals allowed in settings

([current-portal] + settings.COSINNUS_SEARCH_DISPLAY_FOREIGN_PORTALS)

@param restrict_multiportals_to_current: if True, will force objects with multiple portals to

definitely be in the current portal

@param exchange: should we include external API content?

cosinnus.forms.search.filter_searchqueryset_for_read_access(sqs, user)¶

Given a SearchQuerySet, this function adds a filter that limits the result set to only include elements with read access.

cosinnus.forms.search.get_visible_portal_ids()¶

cosinnus.forms.select2 module¶

class cosinnus.forms.select2.CommaSeparatedSelect2MultipleChoiceField(*, choices=(), **kwargs)¶

Bases: MultipleChoiceField

to_python(value)¶

Value is stored and retrieved as a string of comma separated integers. We don’t want to do processing to convert the value to a list like the normal MultipleChoiceField does.

validate(value)¶

If we have a value, then we know it is a string of comma separated integers. To use the MultipleChoiceField validator, we first have to convert the value to a list.

widget¶

alias of CommaSeparatedSelect2MultipleWidget

class cosinnus.forms.select2.CommaSeparatedSelect2MultipleWidget(**kwargs)¶

unicode

value_from_datadict(data, files, name)¶

Given a dictionary of data and this widget’s name, return the value of this widget or None if it’s not provided.

class cosinnus.forms.select2.HeavySelect2FreeTextChoiceWidget(**kwargs)¶

Bases: HeavySelect2Widget

init_options()¶

Sub-classes can use this to suppress or override options passed to Select2 JS library.

Example:

def init_options(self):
    self.options['createSearchChoice'] = JSFunction('Your_js_function')

In the above example we are setting Your_js_function as Select2’s createSearchChoice function.

Tip

If you want to run Your_js_function in the context of the Select2 DOM element, i.e. this inside your JS function should point to the component instead of window, then use JSFunctionInContext instead of JSFunction.

property media¶
class cosinnus.forms.select2.HeavySelect2MultipleFreeTextChoiceWidget(**kwargs)¶

Bases: HeavySelect2MultipleWidget

init_options()¶

Sub-classes can use this to suppress or override options passed to Select2 JS library.

Example:

def init_options(self):
    self.options['createSearchChoice'] = JSFunction('Your_js_function')

In the above example we are setting Your_js_function as Select2’s createSearchChoice function.

Tip

If you want to run Your_js_function in the context of the Select2 DOM element, i.e. this inside your JS function should point to the component instead of window, then use JSFunctionInContext instead of JSFunction.

cosinnus.forms.translations module¶

class cosinnus.forms.translations.TranslatableFormsetInlineFormMixin(**kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Mixin that adds translation fields to a json formset inline form. The translations are stored as is in the formset json field and are not using the translations model field. When using translatable_base_fields needs to be set to the translatable json field. translatable_field_items is populated automatically.

translatable_base_fields = None¶
translatable_field_items = None¶
class cosinnus.forms.translations.TranslatedFieldsFormMixin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Adds extra fields (one for each language) to form. Fields that can be translated are defined in Model, they can either be model fields or fields from dynamic_fields. Translated field names have the structure <fieldname>_translation_<language_code>

translations are saved liked that in model translations json field: {“<fieldname>”:

{“<language_code”: “foo”}, {“<another language_code”: “bar”}

}

Special case - dynamic_fields: {“dynamic_fields”:

{“<language_code>”:

{“<fieldname”: “foo”}, {“<another fieldname”: “bar”}

}

} Be aware: only fields with translations of dynamic_fields are added to the translations json.

add_dynamic_fields_translation_fields(dynamic_fields, field_map)¶

Create translation fields for fields from dynamic_fields. The Fieldtype of fields in dynmaic_fields is defined in the settings, so a lookup there is needed in order to create the field with the formfield generator.

add_dynamic_fields_translations_to_object(object_translations, form_data)¶
add_initial_data_for_dynamic_fields()¶
add_initial_data_for_model_fields()¶
add_model_field_translation_fields(model_fields, field_map)¶

Create translation fields for fields from model based on fieldtype of model field, only Charfield and Textfield possible.

add_model_translations_to_object(object_translations, form_data)¶
full_clean()¶
get_field_type(field)¶

class cosinnus.forms.user.UserKwargModelFormMixin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Generic model form mixin for popping user out of the kwargs and attaching it to the instance.

This mixin must precede forms.ModelForm / forms.Form. The form is not expecting these kwargs to be passed in, so they must be popped off before anything else is done.

class cosinnus.forms.user.UserSignupFinalizeMixin¶

Bases: object

Mixin for finalize_user_object_after_signup, used by UserCreationForm and CosinnusUserSignupSerializer

finalize_user_object_after_signup(user, cleaned_data)¶

Performs extra initialization logic after a user object has just been created after a fresh user signup. This should be called before UserSignupTriggerEventsMixin.trigger_events_after_user_signup

class cosinnus.forms.user.ValidatedPasswordChangeForm(user, *args, **kwargs)¶

class cosinnus.forms.widgets.EasyFormatTimeInput(attrs=None, format=None)¶

Bases: TimeInput

TimeInput widget that allows very freeform time input and assumes sensible times: Short numbers without colons are considered hours, longer number without colons are considered hours and minutes. The rest is handled through regular validation. Examples:

‘7’ –> ‘7:00’ ‘1730’ –> ‘17:30’ ‘132’ –> ‘1:32’ ‘22222222’ –> ‘22222222’

property media¶
